heading.title: Rules of the Faithful Discord Servers
heading.description:
**Not knowing these is not an excuse for misbehaving, and you can and will be held accountable for your actions. Punishments are up to the discretion of the moderators, and harassing them is only going to make your punishment worse.**

*Use `e!modping` or directly ping an online moderator if rules are being broken. Please do not mini-mod!*

expanded_rules.title: Were you warned or muted unfairly?
expanded_rules.description: A much more in-depth version of our rules, punishment appeal information, and our thought process into giving punishments can be found here: https://docs.faithfulpack.net/pages/moderation/expanded-server-rules

changes.title: Last Update: 4 July 2023
changes.description: Disallow politics and clean up some grammar.

rules.title: Read & Follow Discord‚Äôs Terms of Service and Community Guidelines
rules.description: You can find them at https://discord.com/terms and https://discord.com/guidelines respectively. This includes misuse of client modifications (e.g. message loggers) and discussion or promotion of illegal activity.

rules.title: Use Common Sense
rules.description: This is the generic "don‚Äôt be an idiot" rule. Prohibited actions include raiding or brigading other servers, using hate speech or slurs, joking about tragedies or other sensitive topics, and spreading misinformation.

rules.title: Speak English
rules.description: People and by extension moderators can't know what you're saying otherwise, as this is an English-speaking server. Please use a [translator](https://www.deepl.com/translator) if you cannot fluently understand English.

rules.title: Be Constructive and Polite
rules.description: Give constructive criticism people can use to improve their work, not just say that something is ugly or bad. Swearing is allowed within reason, however don‚Äôt cross the line into harassment.

rules.title: Try to Not Annoy Others
rules.description: This includes overly (reply) pinging, sending loud audio or seizure-inducing videos without a spoiler/disclaimer, and abusing nicknames, reactions, or spoilers. Don‚Äôt [ask to ask](https://dontasktoask.com), instead just ask your question directly to save everybody time.

rules.title: Don‚Äôt Clutter Chats
rules.description: While short tangents are fine, we have multiple channels for a reason, so please use them as intended. Spamming random things, including emojis and stickers, or starting a chat chain contributes nothing to a conversation and only causes a mess.

rules.title: Avoid NSFW and NSFL Content
rules.description: This includes, but is not limited to pornography, gore, and overly gross content; if you think it‚Äôs against the rules it probably will be. DM a moderator for approval if you‚Äôre very unsure.

rules.title: Stay Away From Political Discussion
rules.description: General discussion about real-life events is still allowed from a more neutral perspective. If you really want to discuss politics, take it to a DM or another server.

rules.title: No Unsolicited Promoting or Advertising
rules.description: Any sort of advertising that is not in context or clearly solicited is disallowed. Spamming or DM messaging advertisements will get you reported to Discord and banned from the servers.

rules.title: Don‚Äôt Leak Private Information
rules.description: What happens in private channels stays in those channels; keep any confidential information you may have private. Doxxing will get you reported to Discord and banned from the servers.

bot.cant_dm: I can't execute this command inside DMs!

command.error: One of my developers made an error while making this command! Don't worry, the error is not on your side. Please contact <@360249987927638016>, <@473860522710794250> or <@173336582265241601>
command.maintenance: I'm currently in maintenance, please try again later.

args.none_given: You did not provide any arguments.
args.invalid: You did not provide valid arguments.

command.no_permission: You don't have the permission to do that.

description.autopush: Use this command to push textures from #results to GitHub.
description.channelpush: Use this command to send textures to council and result channels!
description.hotfix: Developer-only command to quickly fix something. No defined single use, may change at any time.
description.say: Make the bot send any message you specify
description.status:
Changes the bot's status: 
**Activity**:
PLAYING, STREAMING, LISTENING, WATCHING, COMPETING, CUSTOM_STATUS (does not work)
**Presence**:
online, idle, dnd

image.not_found_in_10_last: No image found in 10 previous messages.
image.too_big: The input picture is too big!
image.too_wide: The input picture is too wide!

command.parse_args: You need to add a [-f= | --flag=] at the beginning of an argument!

submission.searching: Searching for your texture, please wait...
submission.search_description:
Choose one texture using emoji reactions.
If you don't see what you're looking for, be more specific.

autoreact.error_footer: This message will self-destruct in 30 seconds, please re-submit!

submission.no_file_attached: Your submission has to have a file attached!
submission.invalid_format: Please provide a valid `.png` file. Other file formats like `.zip` or `.tga` are not supported yet.
submission.unknown_id: Please choose a valid texture ID!
submission.does_not_exist: The specified texture or folder doesn't exist!
submission.no_name_given: You didn't provide a texture name!
submission.timed_out: You didn't select a valid texture in time!

warn_user.footer: Type %prefix%help to get more information about commands

choice_embed.title: Choose proposition
choice_embed.description: Please choose one result using the associated reaction.
